utterance.speaker: Madison
utterance.content: Sure, lets give up now. It’s no big deal, it’s just Pharmacide, just the tour kick off. Who cares if we miss the most insane party in the world.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Come on Phoebe, victory or death, or possibly cake.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I’m sorry, your caffeine fix is on its way. Will you hold on.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Hi, we’re the DJs assistants.

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: Hold on.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: . No, I said we both work for him.

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: You mean her. The DJ’s a SheJ.

utterance.speaker: Band Member
utterance.content: It’s OK Dave. She’s my plus one. Make that plus 2.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: You weren’t worried were you?

utterance.speaker: Madison
utterance.content: Yes, and there will be punishment unless you tell us everything.

utterance.speaker: Avery
utterance.content: You’ve been here all night?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: After the party we went up to the presidential suite with the band.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It was ginormous, like ten rooms.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: We had a few drinks, and some weed, and played drummer god on this giant plasma TV.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Which she rocked by the way.

utterance.speaker: Kaitlin
utterance.content: I think I hate you right now.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Colt took me up to the roof, but by then the gate to the pool was locked, so no one was up there. So we just climbed over and jumped down and um, went skinny dipping.

utterance.speaker: Avery
utterance.content: Did you do it?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: No. He was so sweet. Later, he played his guitar and he wrote a song for me.

utterance.speaker: Kaitlin
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Jordan, what happen to your foot?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Jordan, are you OK?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Jordan!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foreman expects me to read an Xray on this itty bitty screen. He should have emailed me a larger phone. Why are you packing?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We’re leaving this afternoon for the conference on Pharmacology and Public Policy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We discussed this. It’s been on your calendar for weeks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So has Ramadan.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Think of it as a vacation. Nice healthy Adirondack air. Or not. I don’t care. You’re coming with.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You should come with me. State pillow fighting championships. Dollar beers, wet T-shirts. In the words of the philosopher Eddie Money I’ve got two tickets to paradise.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, when you moved in, I promised your therapist I’d be here for you. I can’t be here if I’m there, unless you’re there too. So it’s not a discussion.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll let Foreman know that the 16 year old patient with the severe edema can wait. Relax, I’ve got no idea what’s wrong with her. So odds are, not fatal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still not going.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She’s got rhabdo . Who wants to come to the pillow fighting championships? Rutgers has got a great team this year, so glad their anchor didn’t turn pro.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sixteen year old girl suddenly has the joints of an eighty year old. Think we can we discuss this for a second?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s rhabdo. Patient gave you the answer. She fell down and went boom. We have to leave in an hour so should we eeny meeny?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The fall would explain lower leg damage, but not the swollen hands.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hard landing caused crushed muscles, crushed muscles release toxins into the bloodstream, toxins cause swelling of the hands and legs. It’s just another way of saying it’s rhabdo. Fifty-nine minutes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She’s a credit card kid. Her parents are architects. They’re working on a project in Shanghai.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Could you be sitting any further away from Chase and still be in the same room?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It doesn’t have to be rhabdo. The swelling could be also caused by deep vein thrombosis.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She has allergies. Could be anaphylaxis or some heart condition that we don’t –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can’t really be any of those things, since it’s rhabdo. I know it’s rhabdo, Foreman knows it’s rhabdo, deep in his heart, even Chase knows it’s rhabdo. Isn’t it annoying when everybody in the room knows something you don’t?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’ll test for everything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s and ass.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Contrast is ready.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She already thinks I’m cheating on her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe this is House’s way of telling her to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sure. How was your day honey, by the way, I killed someone. If I tell her, that’s dumping a burden on her forever.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No sign of obstructions or clots.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell me what you came here for House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ve got a legitimate medical reason.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You must be so proud.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I forgot. I guess it’s no big deal. I was only using it as an excuse to come check out Patty and Selma.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, I feel bad, I haven’t named your testicles.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Word on the street is, you set a new personal best for low-cut.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don’t know why you chose to give them the names of somebody’s aunts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s a compliment. They’re always smokin. Oh, I remember. I need you to authorize the medical discharge of a minor. That’s why I’m holding this in my hand.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Haven’t finished testing yet, but it rha- Your outbox is three times normal size. It’s not a metaphor.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There’s a lot to be done before the weekend.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You take papers home with you. Unless, you’re not going to be home. Unless you were, for example, going to a medical conference.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’m driving up with Wilson.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You weren’t on the registration list.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I love that you checked.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: But Wilson said—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That I have a case, yeah. You’re authorizing the discharge right now. That was a metaphor.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Busy right now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is he dying?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In the next ten minutes?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Unfortunately, no. He’s in a lot of pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ve thought about it. You’re right. I should go to the conference.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You found out Cuddy’s going.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, God no. She’ll ruin everything.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We leave in two hours.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Morphine?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I’m right here. I’m right here Joseph.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two days away, you think I should pack ball-y?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You can’t leave. You lit a fuse, you need to watch the bomb go off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The bomb was going to go off on its own, if you’d kept quiet. So now you have to either come up with a convincing lie, or tell her the truth. Your choice.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: CK levels point to rhabdo.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Except for the part where imaging shows no sign of muscle crush.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi. I'm your doctor. This is Lars Ulrich, the greatest metal drummer of all-time. You know the song?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. Drumstick. Another drumstick. I want you to rock out to the music the way you did last night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go on. This is a classic medical test. Hippocrates used it. Let's go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on, you've gotta keep time! Cross over on the high hat. Let's head bang!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The chart said her potassium's low. Rhabdo elevates the potassium. And monkey drums. Ergo... The levels must've been really low last night. Which causes...

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I can't move them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: temporary muscle paralysis. Given this rate of muscle fatigue, there's no way she could've climbed stairs and then a fence to the pool. Low potassium means no jump, means no trauma. Tests mean "yes rhabdo.” Ergo, something else caused both the rhabdo and the low potassium. This time start by getting an accurate history. Be careful. Our patient's a big fat liar.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What did you really do last night?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We need to find the cause of your low potassium. You could have a kidney disorder, leukemia, adenoma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need to know about any drugs or alcohol, anything that might have threatened your health.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on, Jord. Okay, we didn't spend the night with the band.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: You can't tell our friends.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Have you heard of Stiletto: Warrior Queen of Space?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's a comic book right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Thank you. Yes, and a freaking amazing new sci-fi series, and they're filming the motion picture now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's a prequel.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: The other girls wouldn't get it. Only Phoebe understands my passion. Only Phoebe understands the bushido of the heel.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So what actually happened last night?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: We were with our friends trying to get into the Pharmacide tour party

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I follow his tweets. It's tragic that I have

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He's a god.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So did you guys go up to him?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: God, no. We keep a ten-foot rule. It's not stalking if you don't go up to the person and bother them.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So we just followed him around.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Discreetly.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He ditched after half an hour and went down to the hotel restaurant for a late dinner.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And you went with him?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Discreetly.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We played it so cool. For two hours, we lived his life. We did everything he did. Ate the exact same meal he ate.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The rest of their story checks out. The hotel manager says mom and dad were charged for food and a room, three pay-per-view episodes of Stiletto.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Are you trying to kill yourself? It's from the same batch the girls ate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They ate what he ate. And what a hundred other healthy people ate. Dig in. Lunch is on the Adams.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What if food is the answer? Not this food. Any food. Jordan says she ate all of this. She's 16, all about body image, and she obviously worries about fitting in.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Bulimia would account for her symptoms. We should do a barium swallow for mallory weiss tears, start her on nutritional supplements, get a psych consult.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why are you reading my program guide? It's not like you plan on attending any of the presentations.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like to know how much boredom I'm missing. "Patient perceptions of complications in end-stage chemotherapy." You didn't tell me you were giving a paper.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And that was wrong?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Last time you presented a paper, you gave me an advance copy and asked for feedback.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And you're wondering why I wouldn't want to repeat that experience?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, look! An '80s party. Just when you think you left a flock of seagulls behind in your rearview mirror, suddenly it's up ahead like an undead hitchhiker.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cuddy's going.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you pack my leg warmers?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you want her... ask her out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My God, man! She's not some floozy in a bar. She's the floozy I work for. There's gotta be no radical steps here. Gotta be subtle. We happen to attend the same party, the chat happens to turn personal –.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Like the frog in gradually boiling water.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly. She'll be red and delicious before she knows it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What could possibly go wrong?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Chase went to the gym five times this week.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: One of those times I followed him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I followed him. And yes, I know how humiliating that admission is.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Where'd he go?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The gym, that time. But I know that something's –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm stopping you right there. This is a conversation you should be having with Chase, not me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I've tried having this conversation with Chase.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No sign of tears. It's not bulimia.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Is he having an affair?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why should I believe you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You shouldn't, you should believe him.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Jordan!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Normal sinus rhythm. Heart rate's fine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: BP's dropping.

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: What's happening to her?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No pulse.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Oh, my God! You said her heart rate was fine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cardiac tamponade. Drain the fluid now.

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: What is going on?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's bleeding around her heart.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Blood constricted her heart muscle. She's on antiarrhythmics, but we don't know how long we can keep her stable. Seemed to be triggered by stress. Her parents had just –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did her blood pressure drop during the barium swallow?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Dropped to 50 systolic in three minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rules out chronic conditions.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Acute conditions limit us to toxins, infections.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Could be anything. A gas leak, arsenic in the wallpaper, fungus in the shower. I'll get samples from her room and the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Talk to our little gossip girl. You need to know exactly where she's been and what she's done in the last 24 hours. Oh, I think –

utterance.speaker: Convention Registrar
utterance.content: Welcome to the convention, Dr. Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's my 25th consecutive year.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perlmutter loves the '80s.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Do you need me to leave too?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You might remember stuff she doesn't.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: We didn't do anything we haven't told you about.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We hung out at Jordan's all day. And then we called a limo to go into the city.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: We stopped at Bruce Springsteen's House.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Jord... don't joke around, okay? You're really sick. Just tell him the truth.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Bruce let me play the first electric guitar he ever owned.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My God, why are you lying?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: How can you not believe me?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Turn to your right.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Mr. Keener, I really appreciate you coming.

utterance.speaker: Keener
utterance.content: Oh, it's not that much of a hike. My room's only

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Last night, do you remember two girls, about 16?

utterance.speaker: Keener
utterance.content: That table right there.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: They made an impression.

utterance.speaker: Keener
utterance.content: Well, they were hard to miss with the giggling and the staring.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sure that happens to you a lot.

utterance.speaker: Keener
utterance.content: I'm sure that happens to you a lot more.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She can't control it. A bleed in her brain is affecting her thalamus, causing her to lie. We need to know everything. You two were never apart?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Except for when she went to go get ice. But that couldn't have taken very long.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You don't know?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It was in the middle of the night. I woke up when she came back into the room.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And she told you she went to get ice?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House... 1980s.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You sure? They weren't specific.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How much did it cost you to rent that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was in Wilson's bag.

utterance.speaker: Man at Dance
utterance.content: Dr. Perlmutter, I read your article on neural degeneration.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wait, you didn't really take that seriously, did you? I just wrote that for the money.

utterance.speaker: Man at Dance
utterance.content: Well, hey there, Jane Fonda, would you care to dancercize?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, we were just about to hit the floor.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you. Your leg?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm okay. As long as you don't expect rhythm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You remember the last time we danced? Med school, the week we met.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I saw you in endocrinology. Tracked you down to the hoedown.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I meant, we met before that. In the bookstore.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My third day of school, I hand my syllabus to the guy behind the counter. He barely looks at me. Just skims the sheet and tells me I'm overly ambitious, I have a chip on my shoulder, and I know how to party.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd forgotten you knew how to party.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I said, "you're making that up." And you said, "your class schedule is overloaded, "but none of your classes are before 11:00, "and no one takes Professor Lamb's course unless they have something to prove."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because Professor Siegal covered the same ground and was the easier grader.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I tracked you down. Endocrinology... the party.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And one thing led to another.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And then it didn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was gonna call you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Noo...don't do that. There was no expectations. I was just as into it –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was gonna come see you. Figure out where things would go from there. That was the morning I got the call from the Dean and I was expelled

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I should go to my room and review papers for the infectious disease panel.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hello? Yeah. Thanks for telling me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s 7:00 in the morning. Somebody better be dead.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My patient, Joseph Schultz.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh. Under the circumstances, that's the best thing that could have happened, right?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. I just wish I had been there. Didn't hear you come in last night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, and it was almost 9:30.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Things didn't go as you planned?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We've moved on to a new phase. I tell Cuddy that I've always

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, either she just wasn't ready for that, or maybe she was just surprised and didn't know how to react. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting reflex of guilt just now. Your patient's been dying for six weeks. You couldn't have predicted he'd go this weekend. Or could you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Euthanasia: let's tell the truth. We all do it." That's a great opening line. Are you insane?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't want your notes before, and I don't want 'em now.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, she didn't get ice. She got out in the lobby. She could have gone anywhere. Let's start with for how long. Fast forward.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Stop. Rewind. Back. Wherever she went, she was only gone for, like, five minutes. She's holding something.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's Keener's journal. He must have left it in the restaurant that night. She went back, claimed it belonged to her. She was looking for an excuse to knock on his door.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I know what you're gonna say. I'm not insane. Doctors are rarely

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whoa... I was just thinking of your career. But yeah, if you're one of the doctors occasionally indicted, I guess it could affect that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Someone needs to say what life is really like, now, for people who are dying. What doctors have to go through, the decisions we have to make. Alone. Without guidance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Someone should say that... in an unsigned letter

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'd be telling the truth. I'd be saying what we're all thinking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who cares? The oncology department is subsidized by drug companies. They don't want it run by a murderer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We're all murderers. We just don't have the guts to admit –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And once again, who cares? You won't be hirable anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If there's one thing I've learned from you, it's that I should do what I think is right and not worry about the consequences.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, it's worked out great for me.

utterance.speaker: Keener
utterance.content: Um, I don't mean to be rude, but I'm expecting a notes call from L.A. can we make this quick?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Did Jordan come to your room the other night?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Let me put it another way. We know Jordan came to your room the other night.

utterance.speaker: Keener
utterance.content: Look, I've tried to be helpful. I don't know why you want to pretend I'm lying to you. But this is getting too weird for me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We need to search your room.

utterance.speaker: Keener
utterance.content: You don't, because she was never here.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Allison, calm down.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You would cover your ass at the expense of someone's life? We know she brought up your journal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That was helpful. He'd be crazy to risk his marriage for a one-night stand with a teenager.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Sensible people only risk their marriage for something more serious?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not having an affair.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We're talking about Keener.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fine. He doesn't care about his marriage. What about his career? Statutory rape would ruin it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's admitting statutory rape that could ruin it. Which is why we'll never hear the truth out of him. Rufies OD explains all her symptoms. We should start treating her with flumazenil.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Isn't the MRSA panel going on?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We got kicked out. She started crying.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, well, discussions of urinary catheterization will do that to me too.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The babysitter had an emergency.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh...how did you like '80s night?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House talked with you?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was being subtle about it. You left suddenly. I know House can be a little much sometimes...

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, he was sweet. I just know better than to rely on that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's trying.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeah. I know. I'm a mother now. I need a guy I can count on every single day. That's never been House.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not rufies. She's bleeding behind her kidneys. We're transfusing another two units packed red cells, but she keeps springing leaks.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It looks like a toxic reaction. Keener must have given her something.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The guy's a comic book writer, not a drug dealer.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: There's a lot that wouldn't show up in a standard tox screen. But he's never gonna tell us the truth.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not gonna get the truth out of her either.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We will if we drug her. Amobarbital would suppress

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's on antiarrhythmics. Amobarbital could stop her heart.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's already dying.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're angry at me. You're taking it out on this guy 'cause you think he's lying to you too. And you're gonna kill our patient in the process.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need to know the truth.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We should call House.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. He'll recommend we take the cautious approach.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretzel?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Those are gonna show up on my credit card at seven bucks a bag. There's an all-you-can-eat buffet downstairs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Studies show that $10 wine tastes better if you're told that it costs $90. I'm sure the same thing must be true of grape soda. Have one. We can toast your pending unemployment.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, you can sit here running up my hotel bill, or you can go get the woman of your dreams.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't know Angela Merkel was attending the conference.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I just spoke with Cuddy. She doesn't think you're reliable. And you will remain friend-zoned until that changes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't convince her that I've changed my entire personality in a weekend.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, but you could make the first step.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What does she need?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Today, a babysitter. What are you thinking about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fjords.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You see? Seriously. I know this is out of your comfort zone, but don't scheme. Don't – Just do the deed –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You tell me that I've gotta show her I've changed, and yet you act like

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I didn't mean – I didn't mean... I didn't mean... You drugged me. She's better off without you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Words can hurt, you know.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I thought truth serum was only stuff they gave people in lame spy movies.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We know you're scared. But we know you want to tell the truth. We're gonna help you do that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What happened between you and Jeffrey Keener the night you went up to his room?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I couldn't believe he even talked to me. I told him how much

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Heart rate's increasing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 140's acceptable. Let her talk.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Did he give you anything? A drink, pills?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: He said it was ecstasy. But it didn't look like ecstasy, and it didn't really

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How did it make you feel?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: It just made me really tired.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What did it look like? A capsule? Tablet?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: It was a tablet. Round.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could be lithium.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: He just started touching me. At first it seemed nice. But then... I didn't want to insult him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's enough.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I'm so sorry. I love you guys so much, and I just – I feel like I've let you down.

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: I'm gonna kill him. I'm gonna kill that son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Before you do that, look here. Increased periorbital blood flow throughout. It means everything she's been saying has been a lie.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Everything?

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: S-so you still don't know what's wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, I thought you were room service. Something going on with your patient?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's quiet in there. Is Rachel asleep? I thought maybe, you could use a babysitter.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Actually, I've got her in day care downstairs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh. Great. Maybe later.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Hey, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, Lucas.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: This is awkward.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A bit. That awkwardness would probably go away if I left.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's Foreman. I'm trying to update House, but his phone's off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House! He's not here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Patient's losing blood faster than we can transfuse. Cameron did an online search and found out Keener travels with his dog – we're treating for rickettsia. Any idea where he is?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, no! I was supposed to be giving a paper five minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay...okay...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dr. Wilson has asked me to tender his apologies for his absence. You'll be hearing my paper instead. Unfortunately, there wasn't time to correct the program schedule.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Euthanasia: "let's tell the truth. We all do it. We just don't talk about it. We play the game. We use other words or we don't use any words at all.”

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm. Nice phrasing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hello? Uh...I don't know what department I want. Uh, I need...pants.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: “Patient S, a 55-year-old man. End-stage lung cancer. His pain was beyond the point where we could even pretend to treat it. I showed him how to use the morphine pump. I told him too much morphine would kill him, but not to worry. The machine only gives out so much. To override it you need to enter a special code. I went to the door and told the nurse, 'the code is 328.' I said it loudly. When he first came to my office, I told him I would be with him every step of the way. But I left him alone at the end. I broke that promise. To cover my ass, I failed –"

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was wrong when I wrote that. I've never given any less than my best. I am incapable of turning away from a responsibility. My friends take advantage

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "This is a burden no one should have to carry alone. And this is a decision no one should make alone."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because frankly, I don't trust all of you.

utterance.speaker: Audience
utterance.content: Doctor? Doctor?

utterance.speaker: Audience
utterance.content: Doctor? Doctor? Question...

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Excuse me, Doctor. Not many people would have your courage. Thank you Dr. Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey. Before I start shouting, Foreman says they're looking at rickettsia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks for the message. Continue.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What the hell? You think that little shout-out is gonna make me forget that you drugged me, hid my pants, stole my speech?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You wanted the paper out there, it's out there. And your job is safe.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That was my paper. You don't ask what I want, you ignore my wishes, you drug me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm waiting for you to name something new to our relationship. You've got no good reason to be angry with me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, really? I should be thanking you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If this was about getting the story out there, then yeah. Of course, if this is actually about something else... Maybe you feeling impotent because patients keep dying and you think you need to make some grand, stupid gesture – You need to be a hero – Well, then, yeah, sorry. I did screw it up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You stepped over the line. This was not your decision.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My God, there are 10,000 oncologists in this country. Every one of them loses patients. But only you would feel guilty enough...

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Of course, we can't even argue on my schedule.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's House. Take down the bags.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's too soon to tell if the meds are gonna –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not the meds. It's the blood that's killing her. What's everybody doing? You're stunned, right? I mean, blood?

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: She's had internal bleeding. She needs the blood to –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that the mom? I've got a good comeback if it's the mom.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Yes, I'm her mother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure, she needs blood, if you want to kill her. Then you'd have nobody left to neglect – great plan. Your daughter has vibrio vulnificus, courtesy of a few scrumptious oysters on the half shell.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I didn't eat any oysters.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thus proving that she did. Boy, that's neat.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 100 other people ate those oysters. I ate –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that the dad? I've got a good comeback –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's Chase.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I thought the dad might've been Australian too. There was nothing wrong with the oysters. All oysters have vibrio. But almost no one has hemochromatosis. It'd give her a unique susceptibility to vibrio, cause the swollen joints. But it got attributed to bulimia, so she got supplements—

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: With iron.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which overcooked the liver, which caused bleeding. More blood, more iron, more bleeding, more blood.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Is she going to be OK?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only if we give her high-dose ceftazidime for the vibrio and chelate for the hemochromatosis. Now, Cameron, pick up the phone and give me a dramatic exit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So...how'd you two crazy kids hook up?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I suspected someone in accounting was skimming money, and I wanted to investigate quietly. And since you introduced me to the only detective I know...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And one thing leads to another. Why keep it a secret? You protecting me in my fragile state? You think I was an unhinged looney who was about to go off the rails at a badly timed bit of news?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I just don't advertise my personal life. I needed help with the baby. Lucas drove up.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Yeah. She was worried. A little worried. As a friend. I had to hide

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't think we need to talk –

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: I mean, I imagine having sex with women all the time. No big deal. Though I guess if they knew what I imagine, it could get awkward. And I guess

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A ginger ale would be good. With lemon.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Infection's clearing up nicely. You should be out of here in a few days.

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: Oh, that is wonderful.

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: Jack, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Sweetie, your father and I think we should reward ourselves

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: That meeting's gonna have to wait a couple of weeks. We're staying here.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: You should think about where you'd like to go.

utterance.speaker: Derek
utterance.content: Honey, they're saying the specs are wrong for the whole foundation. Can you at least come talk to 'em?

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Let me see.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: No. Soil engineering report was fine.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I'm used to it.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Who are you talking to?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So...about what happened that night.

utterance.speaker: Jordan
utterance.content: I never even got up the courage to knock on his door.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Well, you'll have to send me their numbers.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yea

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Are you driving?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He looks like a guy who'd be there every day. Minibar is restocked. I say we grab some pretzels for the road –

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: When you do what I did, it's not enough to tell yourself you did nothing wrong. You need to hear it from someone else. If not God or society, a friend. Otherwise you go crazy. What you said to me up there... Thank you. You're a good friend. Cuddy should know that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, you should let her know that I drugged you so you wouldn't confess to murder. Let's get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Someone could have recognized you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: First U.S. conference I've attended in 15 years.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Perlmutter?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Toronto, all weekend. Airtight alibi.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I don't know why I always suspect the worst. If you say you're not having an affair, you're not having an affair.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Oh, God, you are.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Okay. Sorry. Again. If you don't want to tell...okay. But I could help. Whatever this is, it's eating away at you. We could get past it together. I love you no matter what.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We lose patients sometimes. One of those patients... Dibala... We didn't ac – We didn't actually lose him. I killed him.
